title: The 15 early-round MLB draft prospects to know in the Men's College World Series
content: From UCLA's star shortstop to an LSU pitcher who could go No. 1, here are the future major league stars to watch in Omaha.

title: Source: Nuggets' Westbrook to decline option
content: Nuggets guard Russell Westbrook is declining his $3.4 million player option for next season and will become a free agent later this month, a source told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Report: Cops looking to arrest ex-NFL WR Brown
content: Law enforcement in Miami-Dade County is seeking to arrest former NFL wide receiver Antonio Brown on a charge of attempted murder.

title: Civale traded to ChiSox after bullpen pushback
content: The Brewers have traded Aaron Civale, who resisted Milwaukee's attempt to move him to the bullpen, to the White Sox for first baseman Andrew Vaughn.

title: Perez cards 2nd-ever U.S. Open ace at Oakmont
content: France's Victor Perez carded only the second recorded ace in a U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club on the par-3 sixth hole in Friday's second round.

title: Fever star Clark set for return against Liberty
content: Caitlin Clark is set to make her return to the Fever lineup after missing the past five games with a quad strain.

title: Agent: Skaggs named Reds' Miley as drug supplier
content: The agent of the late Tyler Skaggs said in a deposition that Skaggs told him he was using pain pills containing oxycodone that were provided by Reds left-hander Wade Miley.

title: Brewers rookie allows no hits, then forced to exit
content: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski left his major league debut when he slipped on the front part of the mound after holding the Cardinals hitless through five innings Thursday night.

title: Cubs' Crow-Armstrong hits 'cool' out-of-zone HR
content: Cubs center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong thought it was "cool" to hit the farthest pitch from the strike zone for a home run in MLB this season.

content: From group chats to high-level X's and O's breakdowns, the two superstars have pushed themselves -- and each other -- to the top of the basketball universe.

content: The state of L.A.'s injury-riddled pitching staff is alarming. But Ohtani is too valuable to rush back to the mound.

content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

content: We asked NFL evaluators to pick out prospects in next year's draft class who aren't being talked about enough right now. Here are 10 names to know.

content: Saturday sees the start of the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup, with 32 teams playing 63 games between June 14 and July 13. Here's what you need to know about the teams, their chances, and this competition.

title: Pulisic: Former USMNT critics 'way out of line'
content: AC Milan and United States men's national team midfielder Christian Pulisic said that comments from former U.S. players criticizing him for opting to skip the Concacaf Gold Cup are "way out of line."

title: Sources: Liverpool agrees to $157M Wirtz deal
content: Liverpool have agreed to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz in a deal that could rise to a British transfer record fee of ¬£116m, sources have told ESPN.

title: Frank: 'Left a big piece of my heart in Brentford'
content: Thomas Frank has penned an emotional letter to Brentford following the confirmation of his departure from the club after nine years with the club.

title: Walker: I'd give up a PL title for Spurs trophy
content: Kyle Walker has revealed that he would give up one of his Premier League titles to be able to say he won a trophy at Tottenham.

title: Boca's Costa out for CWC after U.S. visa denied
content: Boca Juniors defender Ayrton Costa will miss the Club World Cup after he was denied a visa to enter the United States, the Argentine team said Thursday.

title: Border Patrol will be at Club WC, says it's routine
content: U.S. Customs and Border Protection said it regularly provides security at big sporting events in response to questions about the agency's presence at the FIFA Club World Cup amid President...

title: Gy√∂keres hits out at 'false reports' over future
content: Arsenal and Manchester United target Viktor Gy√∂keres has said he will talk about his future "when the time is right," hitting out at reports over an ongoing rift between him and his club, Sporting CP.

title: Pep on City: Bar√ßa, Madrid would have sacked me
content: Pep Guardiola has said he would have been sacked by Barcelona or Real Madrid if he encountered similar struggles to those he faced at Manchester City this season.

title: Six trades you probably missed at the time that have altered the 2025 MLB season
content: These under-the-radar deals range from a young catcher switching sides in a classic rivalry to a key rotation addition on a World Series contender.

title: Is the USMNT anywhere near ready for the World Cup challenge?
content: With 12 months out from the World Cup and with the Gold Cup kicking off this weekend, is the USMNT ready for its moment in the spotlight?

title: Can Amtrak's busy Northeast Corridor handle the 2026 World Cup?
content: The congested stretch from Boston to Washington is already beleaguered by breakdowns and spotty service.

title: 'Expect several waves of Iranian attacks': Netanyahu after Israeli strikes; US shifts warships
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a strike on Iranian military and nuclear sites, anticipating retaliatory attacks. He stated the US was informed beforehand, leaving further action to President Trump. Netanyahu aims to cripple Iran's missile production, revealing the operation was delayed. Iran has condemned the strikes as a 'declaration of war,' while Trump warned of harsher attacks if nuclear negotiations fail.

title: How precise was Israel's strike on Iran? 10 images show how it hit the bull's eye
content: In a stunning operation, Israeli forces launched a surprise assault on Iran, targeting key military and nuclear sites. The attack, aided by covert Mossad operations, involved smuggled weapons and internal sabotage, crippling Iranian defenses. Explosions rocked Tehran, Isfahan, and Qom, resulting in significant damage and the deaths of high-ranking Iranian officials.

title: Microsoft's top executive to software engineers: If you're going to work with AI-generated code, you need‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: Plane crash: When AI jet became fireball; how 1,000¬∞C inferno made escape impossible
content: An Air India flight crashed in Ahmedabad near the airport. The crash occurred shortly after takeoff. The plane was carrying 242 passengers and crew. A massive fire erupted after the crash. Temperatures reached 1,000 degrees Celsius. Rescue operations were difficult due to the intense heat. Many bodies were recovered from the crash site. The incident also impacted nearby residential areas.

title: Layoffs at Google? Company tells these employees to choose: three days to... or accept severance
content: Google is intensifying its return-to-office mandate, compelling remote employees within 50 miles of offices to adopt a three-day on-site work week or risk job termination. This policy expansion coincides with voluntary buyout programs for select US-based teams, excluding divisions like DeepMind and YouTube. Executives emphasize in-person collaboration as crucial for innovation and employee engagement.

title: Op Rising Lion: How Israel tricked Iran's military leaders before striking
content: Israel escalated its conflict with Iran, reportedly tricking Iranian air force commanders into a meeting before launching a major attack. The strike targeted nuclear and military facilities, resulting in the deaths of several top Iranian military leaders and nuclear scientists. In retaliation, Iran launched 100 drones, most of which were intercepted, further heightening tensions as Iran advances its nuclear program.

title: WTC Final, AUS vs SA: Why has Steve Smith been taken to hospital?
content: Big setback for Australia. Steve Smith is out of the World Test Championship final. He injured his finger while fielding. The incident happened during South Africa's second innings. Smith was attempting a catch at first slip. He has been taken to the hospital for treatment. His participation in the West Indies tour is also uncertain.

title: India has adequate energy supplies, says Union minister Puri
content: Following the recent surge in global crude prices due to escalating tensions in the Middle East, Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has assured that India possesses sufficient energy reserves for the upcoming months. He highlighted India's diversified energy sourcing strategy, ensuring affordability and sustainability.

title: Isis plot: Pakistani extradited over NYC terror plan; Encrypted message warned of largest attack on US
content: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. for allegedly plotting an ISIS-inspired mass shooting at a New York City Jewish community center. The attack, planned for the anniversary of the October 7th Hamas attacks, was foiled through encrypted messaging app monitoring.

title: Black box found on hostel rooftop; key to uncovering why AI-171 crashed
content: In a significant development, the black box of the crashed Air India Ahmedabad-London flight has been recovered from a rooftop near the crash site. The tragic incident, which occurred shortly after take-off, claimed the lives of 241 individuals, including Gujarat's former chief minister, Vijay Rupani. An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the crash.

title: Close shave: AI London-Delhi flight was in Iran airspace when Israel launched missile strike
content: Following Israeli strikes on Iranian military sites, Air India rerouted or turned back at least 16 international flights, including those from London, Toronto, and New York, due to the closure of Iranian airspace. Passengers faced significant disruptions, with the airline offering refunds and rescheduling options. The airline is offering full refunds or complimentary rescheduling to affected passengers and is arranging accommodation where necessary.

title: Shooting World Cup: Manu Bhaker flops; Suruchi Singh clinches gold
content: 19-year-old Indian shooter Suruchi Singh clinched gold in the Women's 10m Air Pistol event at the ISSF World Cup in Munich, surpassing France's Camille Jedrzejewski. This victory marks Suruchi's fourth gold and a hat-trick of individual wins. India's medal tally reached three, placing them fourth. Elavenil Valarivan and Sift Kaur Samra secured bronze medals in separate events.

title: Tesla price hike: Model S and X prices up by $5,000 in US after upgrades
content: Tesla has increased the prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the United States by $5,000 across all configurations. This price adjustment follows an update to these premium electric models.

title: Exclusive: India's next shooting star? How Olympian dad's words lifted Adriyan to WC medal
content: Adriyan Karmakar, once losing interest in shooting, found renewed passion through his father's guidance. He secured a silver medal in the 50m rifle prone event at the ISSF Junior World Cup in Suhl, Germany. He became the first Indian to achieve this feat. Overcoming equipment issues, he utilised his father's old rifle.

title: DGCA orders AI to carry out full safety inspection of its 787-8/9 fleet
content: Following the tragic crash of an Air India Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, the DGCA has mandated enhanced safety inspections for Air India's Boeing 787 Dreamliners, particularly those with General Electric GEnx engines. These checks, effective immediately, include fuel parameter monitoring, cabin air compressor inspections, and electronic engine control system tests.

title: Israel strikes Iran: Netanyahu takes on 'Man of Peace' Trump; MAGA's moment of truth
content: Israeli jets launched air strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites. This happened after President Trump urged Prime Minister Netanyahu to wait. Netanyahu called the operation 'Rising Lion'. The strikes strained US-Israel relations. Iran promised retaliation. Gulf states are worried about the fallout. Trump convened the National Security Council. Oil prices increased due to fears of disruption.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma mobbed by crowd amid Mumbai rain; video goes viral
content: Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma visited Wankhede Stadium. Fans gathered to see him despite the heavy rain. He watched the T20 Mumbai League final. The crowd cheered for their World Cup-winning captain. Mumbai South Central Maratha Royals won the match. Rohit will lead India in the upcoming ODI series against Bangladesh and Australia. He aims to win against both teams.

title: Paulina Gretzky set to inherit incredible fortune from hockey icon father Wayne Gretzky
content: As Dustin Johnson vies for U.S. Open victory, attention turns to his wife, Paulina Gretzky, and her inheritance from hockey legend Wayne Gretzky. 'The Great One' boasts a $250 million fortune, including lavish properties and a custom $900,000 Steinway powerboat designed with input from Paulina's mother, Janet Jones. Paulina's future is secured with generational wealth, potentially overshadowing even Johnson's success.

title: Investors lose Rs 8.35 lakh crore in 2 days amid Middle East flare-up
content: Equity markets faced a significant downturn over two sessions due to escalating Middle East tensions and surging crude oil prices, leading to a substantial loss of investor wealth. The Nifty and Sensex both experienced declines, with investor sentiment dampened by geopolitical uncertainty and the impact on sectors like OMCs and financials.

title: What caused AI-171 crash? 5 big questions, 2 short videos, zero clear answers
content: Following the AI-171 crash outside Ahmedabad airport, videos have surfaced sparking questions among aviation experts. Pilots are questioning why the landing gear wasn't retracted, and if a dual engine failure occurred due to fuel issues. The final investigation report, due next year, will provide detailed analysis.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Tehran's head of missiles programme killed in Israeli strikes
content: Israel has claimed responsibility for an airstrike that killed General Amir Ali Hajizadeh, commander of Iran's revolutionary guard aerospace force, accusing him of orchestrating attacks against Israel. The strike, part of a broader offensive targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, has been met with strong condemnation from Iran. Supreme Leader Khamenei has vowed severe retaliation, raising fears of escalating tensions.

title: 200 jets hit 100 targets: How Israel carried out covert strikes deep inside Iran
content: Israel launched a military operation, "Rising Lion," targeting Iran's nuclear and military installations, including the Natanz facility, in response to concerns over Iran's nuclear program. The strikes resulted in the deaths of high-ranking Iranian military officials and nuclear scientists. Iran retaliated with drone launches, and Supreme Leader Khamenei warned of severe consequences, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Why did Israel strike Iran? What makes the timing crucial ‚Äì explained
content: In a dramatic escalation, Israel launched a significant attack on Iran, targeting nuclear and military facilities, resulting in explosions in Tehran. The strikes reportedly killed a top Revolutionary Guard leader and nuclear scientists. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserted the operation aimed to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons.

title: Assam tension: CM issues shoot-at-sight order; 'groups intend to damage temples'
content: Assam's chief minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, has issued shoot-at-sight orders in Dhubri after a communal group allegedly desecrated a Hindu temple with cow meat on Eid. Sarma visited Dhubri, vowing zero tolerance for those who desecrate sacred places and promising severe consequences for the perpetrators. He stated he would even guard the Hanuman temple himself if necessary.

title: Sunjay Kapur's demise allegedly after swallowing bee; Saif, Kareena visit Karisma
content: In a day of Bollywood buzz, Aamir Khan confessed to a blackout drunk episode on his 60th birthday post quitting alcohol. Tragedy struck as Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, passed away from a heart attack, possibly triggered by a bee sting. Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor were seen visiting Karisma.

title: 'Can't believe Vijaybhai is no more': PM Modi on Vijay Rupani's demise; ex-Gujarat CM died in Ahmedabad air crash
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with the family of Vijay Rupani, the former Gujarat Chief Minister, expressing his deep sorrow over Rupani's death in the Ahmedabad air crash. Modi reminisced about their long association and Rupani's dedication to the BJP's ideology.

title: Pete Carroll fires warning in Raiders camp: 'Everybody's watching you'
content: Pete Carroll, the NFL's oldest coach, emphasizes competition and depth over relying on a single player. He instills pressure in rookies by making them feel constantly observed, pushing them to perform at their best. Carroll praises veteran Raheem Mostert and rookie Ashton Jeanty, excited about their potential contributions to the team's running back rotation.

title: NEET PG 2025 revised exam city list released: Check direct link to download
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has released a revised list of 233 exam cities for NEET PG 2025 on its official website. Following a Supreme Court directive mandating a single-shift exam, NBEMS rescheduled the test to August 3 and expanded city options. Candidates must resubmit their preferences from June 13 to June 17, 2025.

title: Zero-sugar soda cans recalled in the US: FDA cites class II health risk
content: A voluntary recall has been initiated for Dr. Pepper Zero Sugar cans across Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina after it was discovered that some cans were mislabeled and contained full-sugar soda. The FDA has classified this as a Class II health risk, as consumption could pose temporary health consequences, especially for individuals managing sugar intake.

title: One last selfie: Udaipur doctor family's final moments before Air India crash
content: A Rajasthan family's dream of a new life in London ended tragically when the Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, claiming 265 lives. Dr. Komi Vyas, her husband, and their three children were eagerly anticipating their reunion in the UK after years of planning.

title: Israel strikes Iran: Khamenei names new top brass after leaders killed
content: Following Israeli strikes that killed senior commanders, Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei swiftly appointed Mohammad Pakpour as the new commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, replacing Hossein Salami. Abdolrahim Mousavi succeeded Mohammad Bagheri as the chief of the armed forces general staff.

title: Watch: Footage shows Israel intercepting Iranian drones; destroying ballistic missiles
content: Israel Defence Forces carried out aerial strikes. The strikes targeted Iranian ballistic missiles. These missiles were positioned to attack Tel Aviv. IDF released video evidence of the operation. A nationwide siren was activated at 3 a.m. This was due to intelligence about an Iranian retaliation. However, the anticipated response did not happen immediately.

title: Ahmedabad plane tragedy: AUS, SA players pay tribute, honour victims in WTC Final
content: The World Test Championship final at Lord's was marked by a sombre tribute to the victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash, with players observing a minute's silence and wearing black armbands. The Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff, claiming 265 lives. On the field, Australia held a 218-run lead, but South Africa fought back, leaving the match delicately poised.

title: Gautam Gambhir rushes back home due to family emergency
content: India head coach Gautam Gambhir returned home on June 12 as his mother suffered a heart attack on June 11. Gambhir is with his mother at the moment who is undergoing treatment in a Delhi hospital but is likely to rejoin the side before the first Test against England which gets underway on June 20.

title: 'Bold Instagram posts': Punjab influencer's murder linked to moral policing?
content: Punjab Police have uncovered a chilling case of moral policing in Bathinda, where social media influencer Kanchan Devi, known as Kamal Kaur Bhabhi, was murdered. Amritpal Singh Mehro, a Nihang, allegedly orchestrated the crime, objecting to her bold online content.

title: IND vs ENG: Top 5 best Test knocks by Indian batters in England
content: As India prepares for the upcoming five-Test series against England, memories of past batting heroics on English soil resurface. From Rahul Dravid's resilience to Ajinkya Rahane's match-winning century at Lord's, these performances highlight the skill and determination required to succeed in challenging conditions.

title: Why are Iran and Israel sworn enemies?
content: Once allies, Iran and Israel's relationship deteriorated after Iran's 1979 Islamic Revolution, with Ayatollah Khomeini severing ties and criticising Israel's occupation of Palestinian territories. Despite some Iranians questioning this hostility, the current leadership, including Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, maintains an antagonistic stance, even denying the Holocaust. Some supporters of the Islamic Republic criticise Iran's reluctance to directly confront Israel.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Gy√∂keres to Man United? Onana replaced?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

content: The former welterweight champion returns to the Octagon against Joaquin Buckley at UFC Fight Night in Atlanta.

content: In our first 12-team mock draft of the offseason, running backs took priority in the early going in this 1/2 PPR setup.

title: Verstappen vows to 'race like I always do'
content: Max Verstappen vowed to "race like I always do" despite finding himself on the verge of a one-race ban.

content: 26-year-old Roshni Songhare pursued and completed a flight attendant course; she began her career with SpiceJet and later joined Air India where she opted for international assignments; she was set to get engaged in November this year

title: Social activists demand impartial probe in constable assault case, allege role of senior police officer‚Äôs son
content: The police constable was assaulted and locked inside a police outpost by four youths when he asked them to stop fighting; the assaulters allegedly attacked the constable, tore his uniform, and vandalised government property

title: Operation Chakra-V: CBI arrests one man in cyber-enabled fraud case, conducts searches across four States
content: A fraudulent mobile application and WhatsApp groups were used to trick unsuspecting individuals; searches were carried out in Delhi, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra

title: Left parties urge govt. to condemn Israel‚Äôs air strike on Iran¬†
content: Labelling Israel as a ‚Äúrogue state‚Äù, the Left parties urged the government to join other countries condemning Israel‚Äôs action saying that India‚Äôs silence amounts to complicity

title: Indore woman advanced travel for husband‚Äôs birthday; Gwalior boy killed too
content: Harpreet Hora was scheduled to return to London on June 19, but had preponed her trip to be with her husband on his birthday; Aryan Kirar Rajput, a second-year MBBS student at Ahmedabad‚Äôs B.J. Medical College, died when the flight crashed into the hostel mess of the college

title: BJP seeks L-G‚Äôs intervention to drop Urdu for Naib Tehsildar posts, sparks political storm
content: Urdu is rooted in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs history, not in any political or sectarian agenda, says NC leader and MLA Zadibal Tanvir Sadiq

title: Congress asks why Modi continues to be silent even when Trump makes repeated claims about ‚Äòstopping‚Äô the war
content: U.S. has repeatedly claimed to be de-escalating the India-Pakistan conflict, but India maintains that the cessation of hostilities was reached through direct talks between the two countries‚Äô DGMOs

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Couple‚Äôs long-awaited family reunion in the U.K. ends in tragedy
content: Pinakin and Rupaben Shah were en route to their son‚Äôs housewarming in Glasgow when the Air India flight crashed in Ahmedabad

title: Search continues for woman and child missing after Air India flight crash at B.J. Medical College
content: While most victims have been identified, a cook at the hostel mess and her granddaughter remain untraceable, says kin

title: State govt. has taken policy decision not to frame rules to allow bike taxis, Karnataka High Court told
content: Advocate-General told the bench that only eight States have so far permitted bike taxis across the country

title: 571 new Telangana govt schools will be opened in both rural and urban areas: CM Revanth
content: The education system should include skill development courses in addition to language and subject knowledge, said the CM

title: Ahmedabad Air India plane crash: What are black boxes? How do they work?
content: In modern aircraft, there is a Cockpit Voice Recorder and a Digital Flight Data Recorder; they are called black boxes even though they are painted with bright orange to ensure high visibility; black boxes hold the key to aircraft crash investigations

title: TG CPGET notification released¬†
content: Chairman V. Balakista Reddy informed that 46,742 seats are available in the universities in the State and arrangements are being made for smooth conduct of the test

title: Consultants invited for rationalisation and simplification of building rules
content: The consultant agency will review and benchmark the existing development and building rules along with zoning regulations across Telangana against those of other progressive States in India and select East Asian and European cities

title: CRDA nod for ‚Çπ1,052 cr. infrastructure works in Amaravati Govt. Complex area
content: The Capital Region Development Authority meeting chaired by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu approves the proposal to invite tenders for the works to be undertaken in 1,450 acres; tenders worth ‚Çπ682 crore also to be invited for works to connect the Seed Access Road to National Highway-16

title: Row erupts in Bengal over vandalism at Tagore‚Äôs ancestral house in Bangladesh
content: Trinamool and BJP spar over incident; Mamata writes to PM, Suvendu calls it attack on shared heritage

title: 311 properties acquired, ‚Çπ283 crore disbursed for Old City Metro line
content: There are several challenges involved in carrying out the work in the Old City because of the close proximity of buildings almost touching each other, HAML Managing Director said

title: Roof of Jewish synagogue in Mala collapses in rain
content: As an emergency measure, authorities have begun covering the damaged roof with tarpaulin sheets to prevent rainwater from entering the structure

title: Karnataka seeks hike in devolution of funds from Centre to 50%, more weight to a State‚Äôs economic performance
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah seeks ‚Çπ1.15 lakh crore investment to strengthen Bengaluru‚Äôs infrastructure, given its major role in Karnataka‚Äôs economy

title: Assam CM orders shoot-at-sight in restive Dhubri
content: The town has been on edge since the severed head of a cow was found in front of a Hanuman temple here on June 8. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says a group named Nabin Bangla is campaigning to make Dhubri district a part of Bangladesh

title: A.P. lorry owners oppose proposed hike in third-party insurance premium
content: The move will lay a substantial financial burden on lakhs of small and medium transport operators who are already reeling under heavy taxes and penalties and ever-increasing toll fees and fuel prices, says APLOA in a letter to IRDAI

title: Youth value elders, but digital divide, communication gaps persist: HelpAge India report
content: The report, ‚ÄòUnderstanding Intergenerational Dynamics & Perceptions on Ageing‚Äô, released by HelpAge India, sheds light on how ageing is perceived and experienced in modern India. Loneliness, poor health, and financial insecurity emerged as top fears about ageing for both youth and elders.

title: Cargo ship fire: coastal vigil continues amid salvage operations
content: Marine water samples collected from various locations to check the impact of the accident on marine resources

title: Tribal woman killed in wild elephant attack in Idukki
content: The woman had gone to collect forest produce with her husband and children when they came under attack. Her husband sustained injuries

title: Trinamool seeks transparent probe into Ahmedabad plane crash
content: Party urges against premature theories; calls for investigation by ‚Äúproper specialists and authorities‚Äù

title: Kerala University hosts EU-India TTC networking event on marine pollution and green hydrogen
content: Visiting delegation from TTC engaged in discussions with faculty members and experts to explore collaborative opportunities

title: KAU sending seeds to space on NASA‚Äôs Axiom Mission 4
content: The mission will carry seed varieties developed by KAU to the International Space Station as part of a collaborative research initiative

title: ACB notices drama to divert people‚Äôs attention from unkept promises: KTR
content: BRS working president asks CM to face a lie detector test along with him to bring facts before people since the two have ACB cases booked against them

title: Study on online child sexual abuse recommends inclusion of digital literacy in school curriculum
content: The study notes that the COVID-19 pandemic significantly increased children‚Äôs exposure to online risks, underscoring the urgent need for corrective measures

title: Lokesh threatens legal action on YSRCP post on Talliki Vandanam, seeks apology
content: Either they have to delete the message posted on social media or prove their allegations. Else,¬†law will take its course and they will face consequences, says the HRD Minister

title: Belagavi villagers stage protest in favour of retaining graveyard land
content: They oppose survey saying some people are trying to grab the land by claiming that it was Patta land under private ownership

title: Funds for 15 sewage treatment plantsunder AMRUT scheme
content: Centre‚Äôs share of first instalment of ‚Çπ5.25 crore for setting up plants released. Plants are being implemented to incentivise urban local bodies to improve the quality of treated used water by ensuring efficient operations of treatment plants and promoting recycling and reuse

title: CM seeks to exploit differences in UDF over Cong.‚Äôs overtures to Jamaat-e-Islami in bypoll
content: Satheesan says UDF does not share CPI(M)‚Äòs view that Jamaat-e-Islami is extremist , adding its backing was not anathema for Left party in 2009 Lok Sabha and 2011 Assembly elections

title: Gadag officer visits rain-affected, flood-prone villages
content: ZP CEO Bharath S. reviews the prevailing situation in Asuti, Hole Alur, Menasagi and Amaragol villages in Ron taluk

title: Totapuri mango farmers fear produce will wither soon if not procured
content: Totapuri yield is pegged at a whopping six lakh tonnes this year, however, fruit pulp making units across Tirupati and Chittoor districts are reluctant to procure citing two-year-old produce pile up

title: Centre cannot cite removed Section of DM  Act to deny loan relief: HC
content: Kerala High Court says Centre cannot cite a Section removed from DM Act and cite inability to waive loans of landslides-affected people of Wayanad

title: A.P. Tourism Minister Kandula Durgesh expresses delight over GSI recognition for Belum Caves
content: The caves represent ancient culture and heritage, and including them in the Geological Heritage list will pave the way for development of the region, he says

title: Astronomy gallery to be opened in Kozhikode on June 14
content: The state-of-the-art gallery at the Regional Science Centre and Planetarium was built at a cost of ‚Çπ1.5 crore

title: Woman dies as wall collapses in heavy rain in Belagavi
content: Auto driver washed away in torrential rain in Chikkabudanur village near Yaragatti but rescued by locals half-a-mile away

title: AIADMK alliance still shapeless and BJP trying to gain foothold through religion, says Thirumavalavan

title: Israel Launches Fresh Strikes On Iran After Targeting Nuclear Sites, Say Reports

title: How 787 Dreamliner Is Different From Other Boeing Models
content: A Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner operated by Air India crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad on Thursday, killing 241 of the 242 people on board. This was the first fatal incident involving the Dreamliner since the aircraft began commercial serviceo

title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: Israel Launches Fresh Strikes On Iran After Targeting Nuclear Sites: Reports
content: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

title: Congress Office, Ex-Minister's Property Worth Rs 6 Crore Seized In Chhattisgarh
content: The Enforcement Directorate attached properties worth over Rs 6 crore, including assets belonging to former state excise minister Kawasi Lakhma and his son as well as the Congress Bhawan.

title: NDTV Inside Flight Simulator: What May Have Happened In Dreamliner's Final Moments
content: NDTV spoke to a commercial airline pilot inside the cockpit of a flight simulator to get an insight into what could have gone wrong with Air India's Boeing 787 Dreamliner just before it crashed in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Thursday.

title: How Israel Hit Iran's Radar Systems, Missile Launchers In Huge Air Strike
content: The statement said the Air Force jets, guided by precise intelligence, targeted nuclear facilities, military commanders, and soldiers, destroying dozens of radars and surface-to-air missile launchers.

title: On Israeli Strikes, PM Modi "Shared India's Concerns" On Call With Netanyahu
content: The conversation takes place in the aftermath of Israel's attacks on Iran's military and nuclear facilities. The operation also killed senior officials and scientists.

title: First Batch Of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra 2025 Flagged Off By Pabitra Margherita
content: The first batch of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra 2025 started their journey on Friday, with Minister of State for External Affairs Pabitra Margherita attending a formal flag-off ceremony.

title: Israel Shuts Global Embassies After Attack On Iran; Alerts Citizens
content: Israel is shutting its embassies around the world and has urged citizens to stay alert and not display Jewish or Israeli symbols in public places, statements posted on embassy websites said on Friday after Israel launched large-scale attacks on Iran.

title: The Iranian Commanders And Nuclear Scientists Killed In Israeli Strikes
content: Iran said several top commanders and six nuclear scientists were killed in Israeli strikes on Friday targeting Iran's nuclear facilities, ballistic missile factories and military commanders to prevent Tehran from developing an atomic weapon.

title: They Wanted To Surprise Daughter In UK. She Got News Of Their Death In Ahmedabad Crash
content: Her parents had planned to surprise her by flying to London earlier than they were expected to. But, only the news of their death in the Ahmedabad plane crash reached her.

title: How Black Box Recovery Brings Investigators Closer To What Caused Air India Crash
content: The black box from Air India's ill-fated Ahmedabad-London flight was recovered from the rooftop of the medical college hostel building it crashed into minutes after take-off on Thursday.

title: "Surrounded By Smoke, Jumped From Window": Hostel Survivors On Ahmedabad Crash
content: The Air India Dreamliner crashed into the doctors' hostel minutes after taking off from the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

title: 2 NDA Candidates Elected Unopposed To Rajya Sabha From Assam
content: Two NDA candidates - BJP's Kanad Purkayastha and Asom Gana Parishad's Birendra Prasad Baishya, have been elected unopposed to the Rajya Sabha from Assam, an official said on Friday.

title: In Queue To Give Samples To Identify Crash Victims, 8-Month-Old In Uncle's Lap
content: DNA tests are being conducted to help in the identification of bodies of people killed in the Air India crash, and in the queue to submit blood samples was an eight-month-old boy, whose father had died in the crash.

title: Shoot-At-Sight Orders In Assam's Dhubri Amid Communal Unrest
content: The police in Assam's Dhubri issued shoot-at-sight orders after recovery of meat near a temple on Sunday flared communal tensions in the district.

title: Trump May Try To Alter AUKUS Deal, But Here's Why He Won't Sink It
content: The Pentagon has announced it will review the massive AUKUS agreement between the United States, United Kingdom and Australia to ensure its aligned with US President Donald Trumps "America first" agenda.

title: Tears, Photos, DNA Samples: Grieving Families Wait In Despair At BJ Medical College
content: The institute has been swarmed by relatives and friends of the victims, waiting to identify or collect their bodies.

title: After Dreamliner Crash, Insurance Cost May Raise Airfare By 2-5%
content: The aviation insurance industry may consider raising the premium paid by airlines in the next cycle, following the crash of the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad.
